video.title: The Foundations of Entrepreneurship - Full Course
video.description:
This entrepreneurship course will teach you the important lessons that they don't teach you in business school. You will learn about topics such as how to network, how to find customers, and how to get a job.

📒 Get the class workbooks here: https://harouneducation.com/entrepreneurship

Chris Haroun teaches this course. Chris has sold more than 1,000,000 of his online business & self improvement courses in 12 languages in 196 countries and his courses have been profiled in Business Insider, NBC, Inc, Forbes, CNN, Entrepreneur & on other business news websites.

This course is an amalgamation of business advice that Chris has compiled from his many meetings with successful business people over the past two decades as well as observations of why brilliant entrepreneurs like Steve Jobs or Mark Zuckerberg have become incredibly successful.

⭐️ Course Contents ⭐️
⌨️ (0:00:00) Section 1: Relationships Are More Important Than Product Knowledge
⌨️ (0:34:49) Section 2: Be Long Term Greedy
⌨️ (1:02:26) Section 3: Avoid Burnout
⌨️ (1:19:59) Section 4: Create Off The Charts Confidence; Wear That Super Superman Cape!
⌨️ (1:38:29) Section 5: Ethics. Use It or Lose It
⌨️ (1:55:03) Section 6: Every Battle is Won Before It Has Been Fought
⌨️ (2:05:23) Section 7: Goal Setting
⌨️ (2:17:44) Section 8: Happiness is...
⌨️ (2:42:11) How to Complete Homework 1
⌨️ (2:47:35) Section 9: Legal Stuff is Important
⌨️ (3:08:38) Section 10: Management Best Practices
⌨️ (3:32:33) Section 11: Navigating Corporate Politics; Swimming with Sharks
⌨️ (4:01:38) Section 12: Only Take Advice from Successful People
⌨️ (4:09:24) Section 13: Only the Paranoid Survive
⌨️ (4:27:07) Section 14: Risk Taking
⌨️ (4:36:55) Section 15: Sales Best Practices
⌨️ (5:03:12) Section 16: Think Different
⌨️ (5:24:07) Section 17: You Be You
⌨️ (5:45:01) How to Complete Homework 2

🎉 Thanks to our Champion and Sponsor supporters:
👾 Raymond Odero
👾 Agustín Kussrow
👾 aldo ferretti
👾 Otis Morgan
👾 DeezMaster

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.org

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://freecodecamp.org/news

topLevelComment.author: Entrepreneurial Mindset
topLevelComment.text: so nicely outlined course for entrepreneurs

topLevelComment.author: social helpu
topLevelComment.text:
Notes:
1.network is your networth.
2.build a good relationship.
3. Learn to make people work for you.
4.Make a plan for long-term.
5.The best investment is investing on you.
6.Take a little break from your work to avoid burnout.
7.build confidence and character.
8.Change yourself to an positive environment.
9.Don't get jealous on others improvement.
10.Don't be overconfident.
11.accept that your smart.
12.Don’t keep a non trust worthy people with your buisness.
13.learn to identify the lies.
14.over prepare for your problems
15.set your goals high and be patient. 
16.learn to make ideas .
17.money can't buy happiness but your passion can.
18.find something which make you happy when you wake up.
19.if you feel depressed just recall the best moments of your life to boost yourself again.
20.stick with legal things and have a lawyer.
21.fire people by starting the conversation with a good thing.
22. Select the managers correctly because they are the entire system.
23. Be emotionless in buisness but not with your family.
24.take a lot of time before hiring and don't think a lot while you're firing.
25.have a security.
26.don't make statements before properly analyzing that.
27.if you're in need you should ask.
28.be nice to your assistants.
29.don't bring religion,politics inside buisness.
30.communication is important.
31. Take advice from successful people 
32.follow the people you admire of.
33.you can't be successful with a negative attitude.
34.have a backup plan.
35.calculate the moves of others.
36. Don't put all your money into a business, just find investors.
37.be sophisticated (ads).
38.small organization can more effective than the big ones.
39.always Have an opinion. 
40. Don't get manipulated.
41. Have time for yourself and family.
42. You're not too old to start over.

____in progress____

topLevelComment.author: Εργασία - ΗΕ 2022
topLevelComment.text:
Unfortunately, awful content. This is not about starting a business, it is just a bs motivation video for marketing purposes and only. I will have to agree with the others, that no one should spend 5+ hours watching on something this useless. The people that start real-world value businesses and also make an impact are rare. You cannot encourage people to work hard, and then immediately tell them to avoid burnout. Instead, teach them how to work smart. 
I am really disappointed by the low quality and the repetition of the same videos from freeCodeCamp in the last months. You should find and upload new updated and fresh content, which actually makes a difference.

replies.author: glowlog
replies.text: @sassymatazzy what's your business?

It's always the same man with all this things , it's repetition over and over again. All comes to turn idea into a project , grind for it 24/7 and along a way try to learn as much skills related to it as you can , like marketing and book keeping etc... until you manage to pull enough funds to hire someone else to do it for you. 
Problem is having enough funds to start your own thing and enough long runway until that thing starts turning profit , that is the key !
